availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Oct term 1859 Commonwealth vs Mary Killkinny Indt
Disorderly house fine $100 ✓

July term 1860 Same vs Same Indt
Retailing liquor $10,00 ✓

July term 1860 Same vs Same Indt
giving liquor to free negro $20,00 ✓

July term 1860 Same vs Same Indt
Selling liquor free negro $20,00 ✓

July term 1860 Same vs Patrick OBrien Indt
giving liquor to a free negro $40,00

July term 1860 Same vs Same Indt
Selling liquor to Slave $50,00 ✓

July term 1860 Save vs A Gutzuts Indt
Tippling house $60,00

July term 1860 Same vs John Wilcox Indt
Tippling house $60,00

Oct term 1859 Same vs Jane MaHan Indt
Trading with Slaves $22,50

July term 1860 Same vs William McLane Indt
Tippling house $20,00

July term 1860 Same vs Same Indt
Tippling house $20,00

Apl term 1861 Same vs John Hill Indt
Tippling house $60,00

Apl term 1861 Same vs Joseph Naly Indt
Tippling house $60,00

Att James Paton C B C C
By John G Paton D C

Bourbon Cir Ct
within Remission
Issd June 11 1861
